snippet: After a vote by the Working Families Party to support Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, liberals were exulting in what they believed would be the start of a tectonic shift in New York politics.
abstract: New York State liberals exult in what they believe will be the start of a tectonic shift in state politics, as Gov Andrew M Cuomo agrees to abandon his Republican allies in the State Senate and throw his weight behind electing fellow Democrats; in return Working Families Party agrees to support Cuomo.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and SUSANNE CRAIG
byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: After a vote by the Working Families Party to support Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, liberals were exulting in what they believed would be the start of a tectonic shift in New York politics.

headline.main: As Antics Subside, Both Cuomo and the Left Claim the Last Hurrah
headline.print_headline: As Antics Subside, Both Cuomo and the Left Claim the Last Hurrah
